pages.text: The average cultist has two arms and a repertoire of Magan reaching about 100 Units. $(br)A disciple will know that this is not enough. This is why cultists generally form cults with other equally interested $(marked)Players$(), which can assist in Rites with their souls and hands.

However, some cultists may not find willing souls, or a player's soul is just too intricate for $(o)certain$() rites. $(br)This is why the $(item)Rite of Recruitment$() exists. It will forcefully pull nearby villagers to the Altar and will remove their soul, replacing it with an arcane soul imitate. The villagers will remove all their individuality and will be fully devoted.
In order to fulfill the rite, a $(item)Rite Tool$() must be tossed near the Altar, which will cause it to be dragged to its center. $(br)In the end, the tool will be consumed.
The Cultist can be commanded to follow their owner, or to stay at their place.

The Cultist's owner will be the closest player to the altar. Each Cultist will have an Aspect assigned, depending on the Rite Tool that was offered. A Cultist has a Magan pool of 80 Units, which will be drained during rites. $(br)Acting on the Altar while sneaking will summon as many cultists to help as possible in rites (4).
It should be noted that some space will be needed for that, and that a cultist won't appear if the spot is blocked.$(br)A Cultist's stats can be viewed with a $(item)Mirror of the Soul$().
